title: [K-12] Makerspace-Based Science Inquiry Project: Integrated Language Learning Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of basic scientific principles, ability to use simple digital tools, and English or foreign language reading proficiency
context.additional_context: Designing makerspace activities using smartphones, offering convergent education combining language learning and scientific inquiry.

learning_goals: Students design one scientific experiment model using smartphone-based makerspace tools (Tinkercad, Fusion 360, etc.) and implement it via 3D printing or virtual simulation to write an experiment report.

Learners write a 500-word report or a 5-minute presentation explaining at least three scientific concepts (e.g., photosynthesis, gravity, atomic structure) acquired during projects in English and achieve over 80% on a provided rubric (grammar accuracy, terminology appropriateness, logical structure).
Students enhance scientific inquiry processes and creative design skills through team-based problem-solving activities.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
